'''Melvin Taylor''' (born March 13, 1959, [[Jackson, Mississippi|Jackson]], [[Mississippi]], [[United States]])<ref name="Allmusic">{{cite web|last=Skelly |first=Richard |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/melvin-taylor-mn0000351304 |title=Melvin Taylor - Music Biography, Credits and Discography |publisher=AllMusic |date=1959-03-13 |accessdate=2013-03-18}}</ref> is an [[United States|American]] [[electric blues]] [[guitarist]], based in [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]].<ref name="Music">{{cite book
| first= Paul
| last= Du Noyer
| year= 2003
| title= The Illustrated Encyclopedia of Music
| edition= 1st
| publisher= Flame Tree Publishing 
| location= Fulham, London
| isbn= 1-904041-96-5
| page= 181}}</ref>

==Career==
Born in Mississippi, Taylor relocated to Chicago in 1962.<ref name="Allmusic"/> 

He joined The Transistors, a [[popular music]] group. He switched his focus to blues music when the group disbanded in the early 1980s. He found work playing in clubs on the West Side of Chicago.<ref name="Allmusic"/> He often played at Rosa's Lounge in Chicago.<ref name="russell">{{cite book
| first= Tony
| last= Russell
| year= 1997
| title= The Blues - From [[Robert Johnson (musician)|Robert Johnson]] to [[Robert Cray]]
| edition= 
| publisher=Carlton Books Limited 
| location= Dubai
| page= 175
| isbn= 1-85868-255-X}}</ref> 

During the 1980s he joined [[Pinetop Perkins]] and [[The Legendary Blues Band]] in a year long European tour. He has returned to Europe several times with his own group, which has opened for [[B.B. King]], [[Buddy Guy]], and [[Santana (band)|Santana]].<ref name="Allmusic"/>

Taylor's [[sound recording and reproduction|recordings]] include two albums he first recorded for a [[France|French]] [[record label]]: ''Blues on the Run'' (1982) and ''Plays the Blues for You'' (1984). Recordings in the United States include ''Melvin Taylor and the Slack Band'' with John Snyder on the [[Evidence Music]] label and ''Dirty Pool'' (1997).<ref name="Allmusic"/> Taylor's ''Beyond the Burning Guitar'' was recorded in Misty Creek Studios in [[Fairfax, Virginia]].  He also recorded a cover of the [[Eminem]] song, "[[Love The Way You Lie]]" with the [[rapping|rapper]], Matt Christian, at Misty Creek Studios.
